hymn.title: Prayer is the soul's sincere desire

layout.singingstanza: Prayer is the soul's sin -- cere de -- sire, Ut -- tered, or un -- ex -- pressed; The mo -- tion of a hid -- den fire That trem -- bles in the breast.

lyrics.stanza: Prayer is the soul's sincere desire, Uttered, or unexpressed; The motion of a hidden fire That trembles in the breast.
Prayer is the burden of a sigh, The falling of a tear; The upward glancing of an eye When none but God is near.
Prayer is the simplest form of speech That infant lips can try; Prayer the sublimest strains that reach The Majesty on high.
The saints in prayer appear as one, In word, and deed, and mind; While with the Father and the Son Sweet fellowship they find.
O Thou, by whom we come to God, The Life, the Truth, the Way, The path of prayer Thyself hast trod— Lord, teach us how to pray.
